title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesServicePerTeam - Q0001
text: What does 'service per team' mean in microservice architecture?

options.text: Each team owns and manages one or more services independently
All teams share ownership of all services
Each service is managed by multiple teams
Teams are assigned based on technology stack

explanation: Service per team means each team owns and manages one or more services independently, ensuring clear ownership and accountability.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesServicePerTeam - Q0002
text: What is the main goal of the service per team approach?

options.text: To align service ownership with team boundaries
To reduce the number of teams
To share services across all teams

explanation: The goal is to align service ownership with team boundaries, promoting autonomy and accountability.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesServicePerTeam - Q0003
text: Which of the following is a key benefit of the service per team model?

options.text: Improved team autonomy and faster delivery

explanation: Service per team improves autonomy and enables faster delivery by giving teams full control over their services.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesServicePerTeam - Q0004
text: Which of the following best describes team ownership in the service per team model?

options.text: Each team is responsible for the full lifecycle of its services
Teams share responsibility for all services

explanation: In the service per team model, each team is responsible for the full lifecycle of its services, from design to operation.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesServicePerTeam - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a challenge of the service per team approach?
explanation: A challenge is maintaining consistent standards and practices across multiple autonomous teams.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesServicePerTeam - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a benefit of service per team for scalability?

options.text: Teams can scale their services independently
Scaling is limited to the database

explanation: Service per team allows teams to scale their services independently based on demand.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesServicePerTeam - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a benefit of service per team for fault isolation?

explanation: Service per team improves fault isolation by containing failures within a team's services.
